result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Lee Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Lee Peterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Lee Peterson was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Joshua Lee Peterson was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within the first 18 months of probation.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:02 PM. Called 16CF24, 16CF114 and 17CF07. Lynch has revocation paperwork and does not find any inaccuracies or errors. State - have found an error/inaccuracy - states the inaccuracy - on 16CF24 - believe they have the wrong counts listed (counts #2 and #4 on 16CF24 and counts #2 and #3 on 16CF114). State makes argument prior to recommendation - recommends on 16CF114 - 9 months in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other - credit for 141 days (stipulated); 16CF24 - 1 year in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other and concurrent to jail time on 16CF114 - credit for 322 days (stipulated); on 17CF07 - count #1 - 3 years probation. Lynch makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 1 year on each count on 16CF24 case and 6 months on each count on 16CF114; agrees with placing on probation on 17CF07. Court asks for additional information/input in regards to placing the defendant back on probation on the new case. State responds. Lynch responds. Peterson makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 16CF24 - count #2 - 1 year in FC jail, #4 - 1 year in FC jail - concurrent to count #2; 16CF114 - count #2 - 9 months in FC jail, count #3 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other and concurrent to time on 16CF24, on all jail time - huber and good time - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), 141 days credit on 16CF114 and 322 days credit on 16CF24; enter civil judgment for any unpaid fines on each case (paid nothing), right to appeal. On 17CF07 - Court has plea questionnaire. Peterson pleads G to count #1 as alleged. State - count #2 should be DRI. Court makes sure the defendant knows what it means for a count to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, acceps plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community sevice, take all meds as prescribed by treating physicial or medical care provider. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Peterson withholds statement. Court wants statements made by all parties from the previous two cases to be put into the minutes on this case. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to any jail terms imposed on 16CF24 and 16CF114 -  with conditions of: AODA and follow thru - to be completed within 60 days after release from incarceration, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service - to be completed within the first 2 years of probation, take all meds as prescribed by treating physicial or medical care provider, costs - 60 DTP after release from incarceration/CO, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 31, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:03 PM. Scholke - resolved. Scholke - plead G to counts #2 and #4 as alleged, joint recommendation of 3 years probation with conditions of costs on each count, $100.00 fine plus costs and surcharges on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of community service. State agrees, also a $300.00 cost to Forest County Drug Task Force. Peterson and Scholke agree. Court dismisses counts #1 and #3. Peterson pleads G to counts #2 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Peterson makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service - to be completed within the first 18 months of probation, costs on each count - paid thru probation, $100.00 fine plus costs and surcharges on each count - paid thru probation, $300.00 cost to reimburse FC Drug Task Force - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on April 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:30 PM. Scholke - not resolved - is asking for another couple of weeks for a FPT for stated reasons, plead to count #2 and #4, #1 and #3 would be DRI, joint recommendation for 3 years probation with conditions of fines of $100.00 plus costs on each count, no alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment, 200 hours of community service. Peterson undertsands and states that he just wants more time to think about it as he just received the offer for stated reasons. Court will allow one more week to consider the offer, continues bond, also gives the consequences for rejecting the plea, sets for another FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
by mail-notice of appearance and demand for discovery and inspection to DA C. Simono

Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:35 PM. Scholke has complaint and waives further reading is also waiving PH. Court goes over waiver of PH, court finds the defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Scholke assumes INFO will be filed and mirror, enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:08 AM. Chad Lynch appears specially today, this matter will be assigned to John Vorhees. Court has email regarding the appearance of the defendant, medical issues and no ride. Court will continue bond and sets for AIA - defendant will need to be here on that date and time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua Lee Peterson in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:08 AM. Peterson has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Peterson understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, laid off right now, will contact SPD and will inform court if he needs a court appointed attorney. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $2000 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond - $2000.00 signature with no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:15 am.
